algorithm_technique: Graph traversal and degree calculation, checking parity of node degrees.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a graph can have all node degrees made even by adding at most two edges.
problem_summary_technical: Calculates node degrees, identifies nodes with odd degrees. Analyzes cases based on the count of odd-degree nodes (0, 2, or 4) and connectivity.
key_insights: The sum of degrees in any graph is always even (Handshaking Lemma).
Adding an edge increases the degree of two nodes by one. This means adding an edge flips the parity of two nodes' degrees.

If there are 0 odd-degree nodes, the graph is already valid. If there are 2 odd-degree nodes, one edge can connect them. If there are 4 odd-degree nodes, two edges are needed, and their placement depends on connectivity.
